page.title: 03HISTORY OF CLACHAIG.
page.content: The history of Clachaig began when Thomas Harkness fought alongside the Duke of Argyll's forces in the {1715 {Jacobite Rebellion}.For services rendered he was rewarded the piece of land called Clachaig. When Thomas Harkness died, his son came to Clachaig with 15 sheep.He was the only farmer who allowed his sheep to graze freely.He had married 3 times and 76 descendants attended his funeral! After a period of time Mr Sheriff built a factory to manufacture gunpowder in Clachaig.The factory worked from 1831-1905. In 1944 the land north of the public road was sold to the Forestry Commission.In 1948 the bungalows went up for sale and were sold.
